metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42823 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A type confusion issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in tvOS 16.1, macOS Ventura 13, watchOS 9.1, Safari 16.1, iOS 16.1 and iPadOS 16. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
